span.a: You are currently on this page - COVID-19 Information

td.h2: Schools Closed for the Remainder of the 2019-20 School Year

img.alt: Free lunch for students 18 and under

td.p: Click here for more information on free lunch for students 18 and under.

Continued learning will begin for students on April 1. Please review the Continued Learning Plan Guide and contact your building principal via email if you have any questions or concerns.
Melinda Kamrath: kamrathm@deerfield.k12.wi.us
Brad Johnsrud: johnsrudb@deerfield.k12.wi.us

Some internet carriers are offering free and/or low cost options that your family may be able to use. Spectrum is offering free broadband internet and WiFi access for 60 days to families with K-12 and college students. Charter, which operates Spectrum internet, said they will also waive installation fees for new households. Learn more about the Spectrum offer here or call 844-488-8395.
Comcast Internet Essentials indicated that they are providing 60 days of free internet to qualifying families. Learn more about the Comcast offer.

li.a: Public Health of Madison and Dane County
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

div.p: There is a lot of information out there about the Coronavirus (COVID-19). Some of it can be scary for young kids. Here is a great video storybook that can help you and your child work through some worries. Julia Cook is the author of the book I'm Not Scared, I'm Prepared that we use in the primary grades to explain and prepare for an active threat while at school.
